description: Cache Valley, northern Utah. Primary source is the Bear River system and Logan River. Semi-arid high-elevation valley with heavy reliance on winter snowpack for annual supply.

sources.name: Bear River (Utah Compact Allocation)
sources.notes: Utah's share under the 1958 Bear River Compact

sources.name: Logan River
sources.notes: Originates in Bear River Range; peak flow March–June

sources.name: Groundwater (Cache Valley Aquifer)
sources.notes: Recharge rate decreasing ~0.5% per year due to reduced infiltration

monte_carlo.description: Log-normal distribution parameters for annual supply uncertainty. Sample once per simulation year.
monte_carlo.notes: Sigma of 0.11 reflects observed year-to-year variability in Bear River flows (1970–2023 USGS gauge data)

monte_carlo.description: Normal distribution around baseline growth rate. Reflects uncertainty in population growth projections.

climate_scenarios.description: Four named scenarios for fixed-scenario mode. For Monte Carlo mode use the distribution parameters below instead.

baseline.label: Baseline
baseline.description: Historical average conditions projected forward. No change in precipitation or temperature trends beyond current observed trend.

moderate_drought.label: Moderate Drought
moderate_drought.description: Consistent with CMIP6 SSP2-4.5 mid-century projections for northern Utah. Approx 21% reduction in Bear River inflows.

severe_drought.label: Severe Drought
severe_drought.description: Consistent with CMIP6 SSP5-8.5 projections. Prolonged multi-year drought compounded by earlier snowmelt and reduced snowpack.

reduced_snowpack.label: Reduced Snowpack
reduced_snowpack.description: Peak runoff shifts 3–5 weeks earlier, reducing summer carry-over storage. Bear River Range snowpack reduced ~29% by mid-century.

monte_carlo_climate.description: For full Monte Carlo mode: sample a supply shock each year from this distribution instead of using fixed scenario modifiers.

annual_supply_shock.notes: Mean reflects slow long-term drying trend. Std dev captures year-to-year variability. Cumulative over 50 years produces realistic drought sequences.

monte_carlo_climate.output: Reports P(failure) at each year — e.g. 72% probability of deficit by 2048

greywater_recycling.notes: Reduces indoor municipal demand by 28%. Does not affect agricultural demand.

pipeline_addition.notes: Represents a supplemental well or water rights purchase adding to the development allocation.

unit_count_reduction.notes: Each 1% reduction in units reduces municipal demand by 1%. Applied before simulation run.

delay_build_phase.notes: Shifts peak demand onset by N years. Buys time for supply infrastructure to catch up.

pass_fail_rules.fail_condition: Demand exceeds supply in ANY year across ANY active scenario
pass_fail_rules.fail_year: First year in which deficit occurs
pass_fail_rules.monte_carlo_threshold: Project is flagged FAIL if P(failure by 2074) > 15%

data_sources: USGS National Water Information System — Logan River gauge 10109000
Utah Division of Water Resources — Bear River Basin Study 2021
Cache County General Plan 2023 — Water Resources Element
CMIP6 Projections via Utah Climate Center, Utah State University
